It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring elongated, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive venation pattern. The plant thrives in specific microhabitats, often found in rocky or arid environments where it has adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Its reproductive structures are highly modified, with small, inconspicuous flowers that rely on specialized pollinators for reproduction. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
